intro: Geanthus foetens, commonly known as the stinking geanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, and it blooms in the spring. The plant has a distinctive, pungent odor, which is a notable feature in its botanical description.
